description: -D-maltoside, for greatly reducing the surface adsorption losses by ~20-fold for effective single-tube processing of single cells, thus significantly improving detection sensitivity for single-cell proteomic analysis. With standard MS platforms, the method allows for the first time precise, label-free, reliable quantification of hundreds of proteins from single human cells in a simple, convenient manner. When applied to a patient CTC-derived xenograft (PCDX) model, the method can reveal distinct protein signatures between primary tumor cells and early metastases to the lungs at the single-cell resolution. The approach paves the way for routine, precise quantitative single-cell proteomic analysis.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: Patient CTC-derived xenograft (PCDX), single cells, single-cell proteomics, surfactant-assisted single-tube processing coupled with MS (SST-MS), nonionic surfactant

title: Facile sample preparation for quantitative single-cell proteomics
